a115-1.resolution: wq-486 completed in s1355. Pre-commit hook now validates heartbeat.sh syntax on every commit. Additionally, wq-493 (s1357) extended bash -n gate to ALL hook .sh files — broader than recommended.
a115-1.metric_before: No pre-commit syntax validation for heartbeat.sh
a115-1.metric_after: Always-on bash -n for heartbeat.sh + all 83 hook .sh files. Pre-commit hook at .git/hooks/pre-commit lines 21-48.
a115-1.note: Fix effective and exceeded scope. Both heartbeat.sh and hook files now validated.

a115-2.resolution: wq-487 completed in s1357. BRAINSTORMING.md replenished with 7 fresh evolution ideas: hook integration test harness, degraded platform batch recovery, cross-platform mention aggregator, session replay debugger, component test coverage dashboard, Nomic game state persistence, pre-commit hook test runner.
a115-2.note: Fix effective. Ideas already being consumed — 3 promoted to queue items (wq-489, wq-490, wq-491).

a115-3.resolution: wq-488 completed in s1357. 5 new items promoted from brainstorming (wq-489 through wq-493). Queue now has 6 items total (3 pending, 1 in-progress, 2 blocked).

cost.note: Cost trend is declining. No sessions over $3.00 in most recent 15 sessions. B session average dropped from $2.41 to $2.25.

recommended_actions.description: E session s1356 failed to write engagement-trace.json artifact despite engaging 2 platforms (AICQ, MyDeadInternet). Session produced 9 intel entries (d049 compliant) but Phase 3 artifact writing was not completed. verify-e-artifacts.mjs reports FAIL for s1356. This is the first artifact gate failure in the current audit window — not yet a pattern but worth monitoring. Root cause likely: budget exhaustion before Phase 3 could run, or context limit reached.
recommended_actions.action: Monitor next 3 E sessions for artifact gate compliance. If 2+ more failures occur, create a medium-priority wq item to investigate Phase 3 timing/budget allocation in E sessions.

recommended_actions.description: d061 (informational directive about heartbeat.sh changes) is being assigned to B sessions as an urgentDirective, but B sessions cannot meaningfully address an informational directive. This creates noise in directive-outcomes tracking — both s1355 and s1357 show d061 as 'ignored' which is the correct behavior but pollutes compliance metrics.
recommended_actions.action: R session should mark d061 as completed (informational-only, acknowledged by R#224) or add d061 to the session-type exclusion list so it's not assigned as an urgent directive to any session type.
